	The Electrical Engineer / Maintenance Manager is responsible for ensuring the efficient operation, maintenance, and reliability of all electrical, mechanical, and utility systems across the Company&rsquo;s Flour and Feed Mill, Dairy Processing Unit, and Livestock Unit.

Electrical / Maintenance Engineer Job at Farm Katsina Limited




        
    

        
        The Farm, Katsina Limited is an agricultural, flour and feed mill company that deals in livestock farming and other agro processess which includes cattle and poultry rearing and maize flour production.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Electrical / Maintenance Engineer
Job Location: Katsina 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Purpose
     

            
    




	The Electrical Engineer / Maintenance Manager is responsible for ensuring the efficient operation, maintenance, and reliability of all electrical, mechanical, and utility systems across the Company’s Flour and Feed Mill, Dairy Processing Unit, and Livestock Unit.
	The role also provides overall leadership and management of the Maintenance Unit, ensuring minimal downtime, safety compliance, and optimal asset performance.


Key Responsibilities


	Install, operate, maintain, and repair electrical systems, panels, motors, generators, transformers, and control equipment.
	Ensure stable power supply and efficient utilization of generators, inverters, and alternative power systems.
	Diagnose and resolve electrical faults promptly to minimize production downtime.
	Maintain proper documentation of electrical layouts, wiring diagrams, and system specifications.
	Develop and implement a planned preventive maintenance (PPM) schedule for all equipment and facilities.
	Supervise maintenance technicians, electricians, and mechanicsacross all units.
	Allocate tasks, monitor performance, and provide technical guidance to the maintenance team.
	Ensure effective maintenance of:
	
		Flour and feed milling equipment
		Dairy processing machines
		Livestock facilities and supporting infrastructure
	
	
	Coordinate repairs and servicing of production machinery to ensure continuous operations.
	Liaise with external service providers and equipment vendors when specialized repairs are required.
	Ensure compliance with electrical safety standards, company policies, and relevant regulatory requirements.
	Enforce safe work practices and proper use of personal protective equipment (PPE).
	Conduct routine safety inspections and risk assessments within maintenance operations.
	Oversee maintenance of utilities including water systems, boreholes, pumps, cold rooms, and waste systems.
	Ensure proper functioning of facility infrastructure, buildings, and installations.
	Prepare and manage maintenance budgets.
	Control maintenance costs while ensuring quality and reliability of repairs.
	Recommend cost-effective solutions and energy-saving initiatives.
	Prepare regular maintenance reports, including downtime analysis and equipment performance.
	Maintain records of repairs, servicing, spare parts usage, and asset condition.
	Provide technical input to management on equipment upgrades and capital projects.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s Degree (B.Eng) in Electrical Engineering
	Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in industrial, manufacturing, or agro-processing environments.
	Experience with milling plants, dairy processing, or livestock operations is an advantage.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Application letter to: hr@thefarmkatsinaltd.com.ng using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the mail.

title: Chartered Accountant Job at the Vault Recruitment (TVR)
content:
The Vault Recruitment (TVR) - Our client, a reputable pharmacy, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Chartered Accountant

Job Location: Ajah, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Gender: Female (Female for gender balance purposes)
Employment Type- Full Time

Role Overview


	Our client is seeking a qualified Chartered Accountant to manage financial records, ensure regulatory compliance, and provide accurate financial insights to support business growth and sustainability.


Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Prepare and maintain accurate financial records, ledgers, and accounts.
	Manage monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports.
	Oversee budgeting, forecasting, and cash flow management.
	Ensure compliance with tax regulations, statutory filings, and financial policies.
	Handle inventory accounting and reconciliation specific to pharmacy operations.
	Monitor expenses, control costs, and improve financial efficiency.
	Coordinate audits and liaise with external auditors and regulatory bodies.
	Support management with financial analysis and decision-making.


Requirements & Qualifications


	Must be a Chartered Accountant (ICAN or ACCA).
	Minimum of 2–4 years of relevant accounting experience (pharmacy, retail, or FMCG experience is an advantage).
	Not above 40 years of age.
	Strong knowledge of Nigerian tax laws and financial regulations.
	Proficiency in accounting software and Microsoft Excel.
	High level of accuracy, integrity, and attention to detail.
	Strong analytical and reporting skills.


Salary
N200,000 - N300,000 / month.
